Man Utd owner says UK 'colonised' by immigrants; Brit PM demands apology
description: Sir Jim Ratcliffe’s remarks that Britain has been “colonised by immigrants” detonated far beyond a single interview because they landed at the fault line of modern British politics. Linking immigration, welfare and national decline, the Monaco-based Manchester United co-owner used loaded language and shaky numbers that triggered backlash from politicians, supporters and campaigners. Yet the episode also revealed a deeper truth: immigration anxiety now drives the UK’s political mood, fuelling the rise of Reform and hollowing out Labour’s popularity. When an establishment insider says this out loud, it signals how far the Overton window has already shifted.

Neighbours alerted authorities, but the couple was declared dead at the hospital.

He preyed on victims by promising mystical solutions and wealth, extorting money before administering poison.

Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan ahead of Olympic opener
description: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle’s Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year’s international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Erika Kirk addresses backlash as Bad Bunny’s show outshines TPUSA event
description: Erika Kirk spoke out after Turning Point USA aired its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show honoring her late husband, Charlie Kirk. The broadcast featured a tribute montage and patriotic performances, claiming millions of viewers despite streaming restrictions. While Bad Bunny headlined the official NFL show, the rival event blended politics, grief, and culture into a deeply emotional night.

title: After Microsoft power warning, Trump may seek AI pact with big tech
description: The US government is proposing a voluntary pact with tech giants like Google and Meta to manage the booming AI data centre energy demands. Companies would commit to covering all new power generation costs, ensuring no rise in household electricity prices, and addressing water usage and local community impacts. This initiative aims to prevent grid strain and protect consumers.
